titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Ralph E. West papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Loralee Sepsey

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-11-04T16:19-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correspondence, newspaper clippings, serial issues, and other printed matter relating to the Vietnam War, the Watergate affair, and American and international politics during the presidencies of Eisenhower, Johnson, Nixon, Ford, Carter, and Reagan.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ralph E. West papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1977.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lieutenant colonel, United States Marine Corps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection contains newspaper clippings, reports, pamphlets, correspondence to prominent American politicians. The collection also includes serial issues and other printed matter relating to the Vietnam War, the Watergate affair, and American and international politics during the presidencies of Dwight Eisenhower, Lyndon B. Johnson, Richard Nixon, Gerald Ford, Jimmy Carter, and Ronald Reagan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains certificates, notes, a coin, and other memorabilia belonging to Ralph E. West.

did.unittitle: California Continuing Education of the Bar,
Chairman of the Armed Services Committee,
Chairman of the Japanese Internment Commission,
Great Western Savings and Loan Association,
United States Attorney General (John N. Mitchell),
A Choice Not an Echo by Phyllis Schlafly,
The Betrayers by Phyllis Schlafly and Chester Ward,
The Eleventh Hour by Lewis W. Walt,
Henry Kissinger: Soviet Agent by Frank A. Capell,
None Dare Call it Treason by John A. Stormer,
Lincoln's Negro Policy by Earnest Sevier Cox,
The Myth of the Six Million by Anonymous,
Vietnam: An Eyewitness Account by Suzanne Labin,
"A Few Reflections on America in the Midst of a Belligerent World,"
"Summary of Impressions in the Communist World of Eastern Europe,"
"Thirty Three Days Behind the Iron Curtain,"
"Operation PUSH: People United to Save Humanity,"
"President Carter's Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage,"
